By Mark Hosenball and John Whitesides
| WASHINGTON
WASHINGTON Federal investigators have secured a warrant to examine newly discovered emails related to Hillary Clinton's private server
column2: a source familiar with the matter said on Sunday
column3: as a prominent Democrat accused FBI Director James Comey of breaking the law by trying to influence the election.The warrant will allow the Federal Bureau of Investigation to examine the emails to see if they are relevant to its probe of the private email server used for government work by Clinton
column4: the Democratic presidential nominee
column5: while she was secretary of state from 2009 to 2013.Comey came under heavy pressure from Democrats on Sunday to quickly provide details of the emails
column6: as Clinton allies worried the prolonged controversy could extend beyond the Nov. 8 election and cast a shadow over a Clinton transition if she wins the White House.Comey's disclosure of the email discovery in a letter to Congress on Friday plunged the final days of the White House race between Clinton and Republican Donald Trump into turmoil. Clinton had opened a recent lead over Trump in national polls
column7: but it had been narrowing even before the email controversy resurfaced.The unexpected turn in the email controversy shook  financial markets' conviction of a Clinton victory in the election and the U.S. dollar slipped against major currencies in early Asian trading on Monday.U.S. Senate Democratic leader Harry Reid sent a letter to Comey on Sunday suggesting he violated the Hatch Act
column8: which bars the use of a federal government position to influence an election.""Through your partisan actions
column9: you may have broken the law
column12: said in the letter to Comey.Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta and campaign manager Robby Mook questioned Comey's decision to send a letter notifying Congress of the email review before he even knew whether they were significant or relevant.Comey's letter was ""long on innuendo
column14: Podesta said on CNN's ""State of the Union"" program
column15: and accused the FBI chief of breaking precedent by disclosing aspects of an investigation so close to the election.""We are calling on Mr. Comey to come forward and explain what's at issue here
column17: adding the significance of the emails was unclear.

column1: He might have taken the first step of actually having looked at them before he did this in the middle of a presidential campaign
column2: so close to the voting
column3: Podesta said.Comey's letter was sent over the objections of Justice Department officials. But those officials did not try to stop the FBI from getting the warrant
column4: a source familiar with the decision said
column5: because they are interested in the FBI moving quickly on the probe.Sources close to the investigation have said the latest emails were discovered as part of a separate probe of former Democratic U.S. Representative Anthony Weiner
column6: the estranged husband of Clinton aide Huma Abedin.Weiner is the target of an FBI investigation into illicit text messages he is alleged to have sent to a 15-year-old girl in North Carolina. The FBI already had a warrant to search Weiner's laptop in that probe
column7: but needed a warrant to look at the material that might be related to Clinton.

column1: 'CHECK ON CORRUPTION'

Sources familiar with the matter said FBI agents working on the Weiner investigation saw material on a laptop belonging to Weiner that led them to believe it might be relevant to the investigation of Clinton's email practices.Trump has highlighted the issue as proof for his argument that Clinton is corrupt and untrustworthy.""We have one ultimate check on Hillary's corruption and that is the power of the vote
column2: Trump told a rally in Las Vegas on Sunday. ""The only way to beat the corruption is to show up and vote by the tens of millions.""Comey
column3: who announced in July that the FBI's long investigation of Clinton's emails was ending without any charges
column4: said in his letter the agency would review the newly surfaced emails to determine their relevance to the investigation of her handling of classified information.

column1: Richard Painter
column2: a professor at the University of Minnesota Law School and the chief White House ethics lawyer from 2005 to 2007

column4: which investigates Hatch Act violations.""We cannot allow F.B.I. or Justice Department officials to unnecessarily publicize pending investigations concerning candidates of either party while an election is underway. That is an abuse of power

About a third of likely voters in the poll said they were less likely to back Clinton given Comey's disclosure.Clinton

column1: 1	1	http://reuters.com/article/us-cuba-ballet-idUSKBN12V0WU	Cuba ballet festival reflects diplomatic pas de deux with U.S.	"
By Sarah Marsh
| HAVANA
HAVANA A woman in a floaty dress wrestles a minotaur who reflects her inner demons in ""Errand into the Maze""
column2: one of the Martha Graham Dance Company works that made its Cuban premiere this weekend to thunderous applause at the Havana ballet festival.The troupe was performing in the Communist-run island for the first time since 1941 and is one of seven American companies participating in the 10-day event
column3: underscoring greater U.S.-Cuban cultural exchange in the wake of the countries' detente.""The standing ovation said it all
column4: said a beaming Cuban spectator
column5: 64-year-old Maria Antonia Armas. ""It was fabulous. I just hope this exchange will continue to flow."" The Cuban and American ballet worlds have a deeply entwined history and the founding father of Cuban dance
column6: Ramiro Guerra
column7: studied under Graham in New York in the 1940s.Yet ties suffered during the five decades of ideological hostility following Fidel Castro's 1959 revolution.""We keep hearing there is a Martha Graham world in Cuba that we have been apart from for decades
column8: the company's artistic director
column10: said in an interview.""We know it has evolved in its own way and in New York we have evolved in our own way
column11: so to come together and meet our long lost relatives has been very interesting.""While there have been some exchanges between Cuban and American dance in the last two decades
column12: the detente announced nearly two years ago is enabling a broader opening

column1: For one
column2: it has made traveling and securing financing much easier
column3: she said. Regular commercial flights were re-established in August and American companies such as Jetblue are keen to provide sponsorship in order to gain market recognition in Cuba.'SOPHISTICATED PALATES'

column1: Cuban spectators said the modern and contemporary U.S. choreographies performed during the opening weekend of the 25th Havana ballet festival were like a breath of fresh air.
While Cuban ballet has fused the best from the Russians
column2: French
column3: Italians
column4: English and Americans with Latin flair and Afro-Cuban sensuality
column5: its style has also been criticized as outdated.It is based on the approach of the Ballet Nacional de Cuba's 94-year-old founder
column6: Alicia Alonso
column7: a principal dancer in the 1940s with the company now known as American Ballet Theater.Alonso's choreographies to classics like Swan Lake
column8: Giselle and Sleeping Beauty feature heavily throughout the biannual festival
column9: which from this year onwards will be named after her.New York City Ballet choreographer Justin Peck
column10: who brought four works to the festival
column11: said he aimed above all to keep ""pushing the envelope"".

column1: Classical ballet is an evolution so it should take certain careful steps forward
column2: the 29-year old told a news conference.Peck and others said it was a treat to perform in a society where the public is so enthusiastic about their art.Ballet may not be avant-garde in Cuba but it is mainstream entertainment
column3: with tickets costing less than half a dollar and performances shown on public television.""They have one of most sophisticated palates for ballet
column4: for dance and for art in the world
column5: said Peck.Dancers and companies representing sixteen countries in total will participate in the festival
column6: including for the first time South Korea's Universal Ballet Company and the lead dancer from the National Ballet of Mongolia. (Reporting by Sarah Marsh; Editing by Mary Milliken)"	[]	[]

column1: 2	2	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-trump-idUSKCN12U013	Trump mounts bid to turn Clinton controversy to his advantage	"
By Steve Holland
| PHOENIX
PHOENIX Sensing a potential turning point
column2: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump mounted a furious effort on Saturday to portray Democrat Hillary Clinton as unfit to lead the country after the latest chapter in her email controversy unfolded as he tries to mount a comeback.With the Nov. 8 election only 10 days away
column3: Trump devoted much of his stump speech to try to take the maximum advantage of the FBI's disclosure that it is investigating more emails as part of a probe into Clinton's use of a private email server.Little is known about the extent and focus of the new FBI review. But Trump was quick to declare his rival ""guilty"" at rallies in Phoenix and in Golden
column4: Colorado
column5: declaring that she is symbolic of a type of public corruption that is a ""grave threat to our democracy.""Trump charged that the Justice Department
column6: populated by appointees of Democratic President Barack Obama
column7: is trying to help Clinton
column8: given news reports that top department officials did not want FBI Director James Comey to reveal his new review.

column1: When the outcome is fixed
column2: when the system is rigged
column3: people lose hope. They stop dreaming. They stop trying
column4: Trump said in Phoenix. ""Hillary Clinton's corruption is corrosive to the soul of our nation and it must be stopped.""Clinton herself has repeatedly attacked Trump as not fit to be president.The new uproar could not have come at a more opportune time for Trump
column5: who has been reeling for weeks from the release of a 2005 audio tape in which he boasted about groping women and the emergence of a host of women who said he did just that to them.

column1: Trump has narrowed the gap in public opinion polls between him and Clinton nationally and in some battleground states where the election is likely to be decided. But most analyses of the polls show him facing a defeat
column2: perhaps a landslide
column3: if the election were to be held today. That made it essential for Trump to try to change the subject from his own setbacks and focus on those of Clinton
column4: and give establishment Republicans who have been reluctant to support him a reason to get behind him
column5: and perhaps sway some undecided voters as well.

column1: Still
column2: the Phoenix rally provided a reminder why some Republicans cannot bring themselves to support Trump
column3: as a man there taunted reporters with a chant of ""Jew S. A."" when the rest of the crowd was chanting ""USA.""Trump's next couple of days on the campaign trail reflect a change in strategy with uncertain rewards. He is to campaign in Albuquerque
column4: New Mexico
column5: on Sunday and in Michigan on Monday
column6: two states that have voted Democratic in recent presidential elections and appeared poised to do so again. (Reporting by Steve Holland; Editing by Mary Milliken and Leslie Adler)"	['Clinton'

column1: 5	5	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-poll-idUSKCN12T0J6	Clinton enjoys solid lead in early voting: Reuters/Ipsos poll	"
By Maurice Tamman
| NEW YORK
NEW YORK With 11 days to go before the U.S. presidential election
column2: Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton leads Republican Donald Trump by 15 percentage points among early voters surveyed in the past two weeks
column3: according to the Reuters/Ipsos States of the Nation project.Though data is not available for all early voting states
column4: Clinton enjoys an edge in swing states such as Ohio and Arizona and in Republican Party strongholds such as Georgia and Texas.An estimated 19 million Americans have voted so far in the election
column5: according to the University of Florida's United States Election Project
column6: accounting for as much as 20 percent of the electorate.Overall
column7: Clinton remained on track to win a majority of votes in the Electoral College
column8: the Reuters/Ipsos survey showed.Having so many ballots locked down before the Nov. 8 election is good news for the Clinton campaign. On Friday
column9: the Federal Bureau of Investigation announced that it is examining newly discovered emails belonging to Clinton's close aide
column10: Huma Abedin. Those emails were found on a computer belonging to Anthony Weiner
column12: during an unrelated investigation into illicit messages he is alleged to have sent to a teenage girl. The Reuters/Ipsos survey was conducted before the news emerged Friday afternoon.It remains unclear whether the FBI inquiry will upset the balance in the race. The bureau disclosed nothing about the Abedin emails
column13: including whether any of the messages were sent by or to Clinton. Over the summer
column14: the FBI said it was closing its investigation into Clinton's use of a private email system while secretary of state. Until Friday
column15: her campaign seemed to have weathered the initial FBI email probe.

column1: Clinton has held a lead averaging four to seven percentage points in polls in recent weeks as the Trump campaign wrestled with accusations by women of groping and other sexual advances. Trump has said none of the accusations are true. He also struggled in the recent presidential debates and faced questions about his taxes.As of Thursday
column2: Clinton's odds of receiving the 270 Electoral College votes needed to win the presidency remained at greater than 95 percent
column3: according to State of the Nation polling results released Saturday. The project estimated she would win by 320 votes to 218
column4: with 278 votes solidly for the Democrat.Clinton's lead among early voters is similar to the lead enjoyed by President Barack Obama over Republican Mitt Romney at this point of the 2012 race
column5: according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll taken at the time. Obama won the election by 332 electoral votes to Romney's 206.But even before the latest email news
column6: it had been a difficult week for Clinton. News coverage of Trump's accusers had diminished
column7: while Clinton confronted the almost daily release by WikiLeaks of emails purportedly hacked from her campaign manager's account. This week's leaked messages raised questions about former President Bill Clinton's finances.

column1: And her lead in the States of the Nation project fell slightly from last week. Though the projected Electoral College votes hardly moved
column2: the number of states solidly for Clinton slid from 25 to 20 this week. Trump didn't see any additional states tilt solidly to him
column3: but he did see some gains: The swing states of Pennsylvania
column4: Colorado
column5: Iowa and Nevada all moved from leaning to Clinton to being too close to call.Still
column6: Trump's path to a victory is narrow
column7: and any realistic chance rests on his winning Ohio
column8: North Carolina and Florida. As of Thursday
column9: Ohio remained a toss-up. Florida and North Carolina were still tilting toward Clinton
column10: according to the States of the Nation results.Early voting data for Florida and North Carolina was not yet available this week. In Ohio
column11: Clinton led Trump by double digits among early voters. The project's broader polling suggests the state is deadlocked between the two candidates.

column1: In Arizona
column2: Clinton also was solidly ahead among early voters. In the past month
column3: Arizona has gradually moved from a solid Trump state to a marginal Clinton state
column4: although it is still too close to call
column5: according to the project results.In Georgia
column6: she enjoyed a similar lead among early voters. Overall
column7: Georgia leans to Trump
column8: but his lead narrowed to five percentage points this week
column9: down from eights points last week and 13 points a month ago.Even in Texas
column10: where Trump enjoys a sizable lead
column11: Clinton has a double-digit edge among early voters
column12: according to project results.The States of the Nation project is a survey of about 15
column13: 000 people every week in all 50 states plus Washington D.C. State by state results are available by visiting here (Editing by James Dalgleish)"	['Clinton'

By Roberta Rampton
| MIAMI
MIAMI Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton
column2: whose buoyant position in opinion polls has been threatened by a surprising new twist in the saga over her emails

column6: said Troy

column1: 7	7	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-weiner-factbox-idUSKCN12T0PM	Factbox - How Carlos Danger got tangled up in the Clinton email scandal	"
By Jonathan Allen
| NEW YORK
NEW YORK Anthony Weiner
column2: the disgraced former U.S. congressman
column3: has emerged as an unexpected figure in the Federal Bureau of Investigation's inquiry into Hillary Clinton's handling of classified government information on a private email server she used while secretary of state.The FBI said on Friday it is examining newly discovered emails related to the server investigation
column4: giving new life to a scandal less than two weeks before Clinton stands as the Democratic candidate in the U.S. presidential election.The FBI called Clinton's handling of government secrets ""extremely careless"" in July after a year-long investigation

column6: one of Clinton's closest aides

column8: Abedin's estranged husband

column1: A Brooklyn native
column2: Weiner
column4: represented parts of New York City in the U.S. House of Representatives for more than a decade
column5: and his marriage to Abedin was officiated by Bill Clinton

column7: combative wit until 2011

column1: After atoning in press interviews for the strain he placed on his marriage with Abedin

column3: and he was atop the public polls when revelations broke he had never shaken his sexting habit. He admitted he had continued to swap messages and pictures with women using the alias Carlos Danger.WHAT DID ABEDIN DO?

column1: Abedin
column2: who has worked for Clinton since she was 19

column4: but remained married to him as they raised their young son together.While a diminished Weiner worked as a television commentator
column5: Abedin
column6: who had left the State Department with Clinton in 2013
column7: focused on Clinton's forthcoming presidential campaign
column8: for which she was appointed vice chairwoman. Clinton rarely appears in public without Abedin somewhere nearby. Multilingual
column9: intensely private and with a glamour validated by Vogue magazine photo shoots
column10: Abedin became a star in her own right as Clinton campaigned across the country
column11: obliging countless requests by Clinton supporters to pose for their smartphone cameras.

column1: DID WEINER QUIT SEXTING?
No
column2: and this year it reached a breaking point. In August
column3: Abedin announced she was separating from Weiner after a newspaper published a picture Weiner sent to a woman of him lounging on his bed in his underwear; Weiner's and Abedin's four-year-old son could be seen at his side.The FBI began investigating after it emerged that one of his sexting partners was 15 years old
column4: a legal minor. The agency seized devices used by both Weiner and Abedin
column5: finding the new email cache soon after. Investigators are looking to see if yet more classified information appears in the new cache.

column1: IS DONALD TRUMP CELEBRATING?
Yes. Clinton's Republican rival for the presidency has devoted his last few rallies to reveling in the news
column2: a diversion from accusations by multiple women that Trump groped them. Clinton
column3: who remains ahead in public polls
column4: argued on Friday that most voters may have already decided whether or not Clinton's mishandling of classified information in her emails is disqualifying.WHAT WILL HAPPEN TO ABEDIN?

column1: Clinton has called Abedin
column3: a surrogate daughter
column4: and the aide was at Clinton's side even after the news broke on Friday. Her loyalty to Clinton is unmistakable in the hundreds of emails of hers that have already been made public. Abedin has spent more than two decades accruing knowledge of Clinton's habits

column7: and may be viewed as irreplaceable.   (Reporting by Jonathan Allen; Editing by Leslie Adler and Mary Milliken)"	['Allen'

column1: 8	8	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-clinton-idUSKCN12S299	Clinton email problem resurfaces as FBI announces review	"
By Mark Hosenball and Jonathan Allen
| WASHINGTON/NEW YORK

column1: Two sources close to the investigation said the latest emails were discovered not during an investigation into Clinton
column2: but rather as part of a separate probe into Anthony Weiner
column3: the estranged husband of top Clinton aide Huma Abedin.The FBI has been investigating illicit text messages allegedly sent from Weiner to a 15-year-old girl in North Carolina
column4: and found the Clinton emails on a device related to that investigation

column7: according to a summary of the interview released by the FBI in September. She said it was difficult to print from the State Department's email system so she routinely forwarded documents to her private accounts when she needed to print them out
column8: according to the summary.

column1: Abedin announced her separation from Weiner in August after a sex scandal similar to an earlier incident that led him to resign from the U.S. Congress.Lawyers representing Abedin did not respond to questions sent by email on Friday. Weiner did not immediately respond to an email seeking comment

column1: 9	9	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-poll-idUSKCN12S2M5	Clinton leads Trump 42 to 36 percent as he loses women's support: poll	"
By Chris Kahn
| NEW YORK
NEW YORK Democrat Hillary Clinton's lead over Republican rival Donald Trump widened to 6 percentage points in the latest Reuters/Ipsos U.S. presidential tracking poll
column2: released on Friday
column3: showing Trump losing support among women.The Oct. 21-27 opinion poll shows 42 percent of people who either voted already or expect to vote in the Nov. 8 election support Clinton
column4: versus 36 percent for Trump. Clinton's lead a week ago was 4 points.The polling was conducted before Clinton's campaign was hit on Friday by the FBI announcement that it was investigating more emails as part of a probe into her use of a private email server while secretary of state. FBI Director James Comey said in a letter to several congressional Republicans that the agency had learned of the existence of emails that appeared to be pertinent to its investigation. However
column5: he said the FBI did not know if the emails were significant and did not provide a time frame for the probe.(GRAPHIC: Race to the White House tmsnrt.rs/298mTyD)   Trump
column6: a New York businessman seeking his first elected office
column7: has consistently trailed Clinton in the poll. His level of support has remained below 40 percent among all likely voters since the beginning of September.

column1: Clinton leads Trump by 10 points among likely women voters
column2: up from a 4-point lead the previous week. Clinton has led Trump among women over the last two months
column3: though the size of her advantage has varied widely from 1 point to 11 points.In a 2005 video that emerged this month
column4: Trump could be heard bragging in vulgar terms about groping and kissing women.  At least a dozen women have since publicly accused him of making unwanted sexual advances. Trump denies the allegations. Trump still has an edge among white women
column5: a key source of strength for Republicans. Trump leads Clinton by 2 points with this group
column6: down from a 12-point lead the previous week.

column1: Women tend to lean Democratic
column2: but Reuters/Ipsos polling this month shows a majority of women have an unfavorable view of the former U.S. secretary of state and believe she is not honest and truthful.    Clinton also led Trump by 6 points in a separate Reuters/Ipsos poll that included alternative party candidates. Both polls
column3: conducted online in English in all 50 states
column4: included 1
column5: 627 American adults who were considered to be likely voters from their voting history
column6: registration status and stated intention to vote.

column1: That sample included 965 likely women voters and 776 likely white women voters. Individual responses were adjusted to reflect the overall U.S. population. The poll has a credibility interval
column2: a measure of accuracy
column3: of 3 percentage points for the total sample and 4 percentage points for the women voters.The RealClearPolitics website
column4: which tracks most major polls
column5: shows Clinton leading Trump by an average of 5 percentage points.  (Editing by Howard Goller and Jonathan Oatis)"	['Clinton'
